title: Another European country to ban burka over safety fears
text:
Another European country to ban burka over safety fears Another European country to ban burka over safety fears ANOTHER state is set to ban the burka over fears for public security. / Published 22nd February 2017 
The German region of Bavaria plans to ban the full-face Islamic veils in schools, universities, government workplaces and polling stations. 
The region will join five countries in Europe – including France and Belgium – who have complete bans on burka face coverings. 
German Chancellor Angela Merkel previously called for a ban on full-face Muslim veils "wherever legally possible" – but so far the ban is not nationwide. 
GETTY BANNED: Bavaria is drafting a law to ban the full-face burka (stock photo) 
GETTY ISLAMIC DRESS: The difference between the coverings for Muslim women “Concealing your face is at odds with this culture of communication” Bavarian Interior Minister Joachim Herrmann 
The move comes seven months before Germany’s federal election where immigration will be a key issue. 
The Bavarian government has now agreed to a draft law to ban the full-face veil for civil servants and in public places where there are concerns for public safety. 
Bavarian Interior Minister Joachim Herrmann said: “Communication happens not only via language but also via looks, facial expressions and gestures. 
"It's the foundation of our interactions with each other and it's the basis of our free and democratic order. 
DS EUROPE: Countries which have banned or have issued partial bans on the burka 
"Concealing your face is at odds with this culture of communication." 
The move come after more than a million, mainly Muslim, migrants have arrived in Germany over the last two years amid security fears following several Islamist attacks last year. Burka bans across Europe Thursday, 22nd December 2016 Which European countries have some kind of ban on Islamic face coverings, such as the hijab, niqab and burka? 1 / 14 GETTY France: Became first country in Europe to ban the burka in April 2011, with a penalty fine of 150 euro 
Nine people – including seven teens – were killed after a gunman stormed a McDonald’s in Munich. 
France, Belgium and the Netherlands have agreed complete bans on Islamic face coverings and Germany, Spain, Italy, Switzerland and Denmark have bans in some places. 
The Bavarian conservatives party which governs the region are concerned about losing votes to the anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany in the election later this year. Related articles
